sentences.en: Ambition often spends foolishly what avarice had wickedly collected.
sentences.cn: 贪婪不择手段地收集起来的东西,常被野心愚蠢地耗去.

sentences.en: Avarice is the bane to happiness.
sentences.cn: 贪婪是损毁幸福的祸根.

sentences.en: Avarice makes rich people want to become even richer.
Courage in excess become foolhardiness, affection weakness, thrift avarice.
sentences.cn: 勇敢过度,即成蛮勇; 感情过度,即成溺爱; 俭约过度,即成贪婪.

sentences.en: Courage in excess becomes foolhardiness, affection weakness, thrift avarice.
sentences.cn: 勇敢过度即成蛮勇, 感情过度即成溺爱, 节俭过度即成贪婪.

sentences.en: Had I really loved, could I have sacrificed my feelings to vanity, to avarice.
sentences.cn: 倘使我真心爱过人, 难道我会为了虚荣或贪婪而牺牲自己的感情?

sentences.en: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.
sentences.cn: 他预交了一个月的房租，正好满足了房东的贪心。

sentences.en: The chief ingredient in the making of a criminal is avarice.
sentences.cn: 造成犯罪的主要因素是贪婪.

sentences.en: Their avarice knows no bounds; you can never satisfy them.
sentences.cn: 他们贪得无厌, 你永远无法满足他们.

sentences.en: We became quite renowned as a compound of pride, avarice, brutality, and meanness.
sentences.cn: 我知道这个人不是个东西,集骄傲 、 贪婪 、 残暴 、 卑鄙于一身.

trans.tran_en: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong
